DataElement.preferredName: Symptomatic Chronic Heart Disease Present Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether symptomatic or uncontrolled cardiac disease is present.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to symptomatic chronic heart disease being present.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Having to do with symptoms, which are signs of a condition or disease.:No value exists.

Concepts.definition: Exhibiting the symptoms of a particular disease.

Property.preferredDefinition: Present; the period of time that is happening now.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of myocardial infarction or unstable angina <=6 months prior to registration or congestive heart failure (CHF) requiring use of ongoing maintenance therapy, or life-threatening ventricular arrhythmias

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient has experienced any arterial thromboembolic events, included but not limited to myocardial infarction, stroke, transient ischemic attack (TIA), cerebrovascular accident, or unstable angina <=6 months prior to randomization or congestive heart failure requiring use of ongoing maintenance therapy for life-threatening ventricular arrhythmias

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of myocardial infarction or unstable angina <=6 months prior to registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have grade 2 or greater bradycardia

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have grade 2 or greater sinus bradycardia

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient experienced significant cardiac arrhythmias, stroke or myocardial infarction within 6 months prior to enrollmen

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of cardiac arrhythmia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: History of myocardial infarction <=6 months, or congestive heart failure requiring use of ongoing maintenance therapy for life-threatening ventricular arrythmias.

ReferenceDocuments.name: LCC Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Presence of symptoms and signs of HF:

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of unstable cardiac arrhythmia?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: History (within the previous year) of stroke or transient ischemic attack, unstable angina, myocardial infarction or hospitalization for acutely decompensated congestive heart failure

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have severe cardiac disease?
